comment.author: 73509022@N00
7211509@N04
comment._content:
The USS Texas remains retired, moored in Houston, Texas, adjacent to the San Jacinto Battlefield and Monument where Gen. Sam Houston and the Texas army defeated Mexican Gen. Santa Anna and his troops.  This was 1836 and the cry was "Remember the Alamo".  Mexican troops were caught napping, which gave the Texas soldier's the advantage.  This was the Battle that won Texas Independence from Mexico and was the beginning of the Republic Of Texas.  My ancestor's fought there that day and their names are engraved on the enterior of the Monument.
The Battleship Texas and the San Jacinto Battlefield are open for visitors.

comment._content: This was taken sometime between keel laying on 17 April 1911 and  her launching on 18 May 1912 at at Newport News, Virginia.
